definition: to offend sb/to make a faux pas/a faux pas/see also 得罪[de2 zui4]
to commit an offense/to violate the law/excuse me! (formal)/see also 得罪[de2 zui5]
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
variant of 罪[zui4], crime
guilt/crime/fault/blame/sin

sentences.english: Some of the most popular expressions are those that are guaranteed not to offend anyone.
sentences.chinese: 一些最流行的表达是那些保证不会得罪任何人的表达。

sentences.english: Offending United States because of Irq is not in their national interests.
sentences.chinese: 为伊拉克而得罪美国，不符合他们的国家利益啊。

sentences.english: Chinese is not my mother tongue, so if I've written something wrong or offended someone, I wish all of you could excuse me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我有什么写错或者有得罪的地方，请诸位别见笑。

sentences.english: The superficial nobody dares to give misdemeanour to you and make in the behind floor Ban son of will be more.
sentences.chinese: 表面上没人敢得罪你，在背地里使绊子的会更多。

sentences.english: It appears you are the emotional one, but am I offended?
sentences.chinese: 你现在好像也很冲动，得罪朕了么？

sentences.english: In a fight to save in Bai Yang and lentils.
sentences.chinese: 在一次打架斗殴中杨林为了救白文得罪了沈庆和扁豆。

sentences.english: He got in Dutch with his boss and in a few months he was fired.
sentences.chinese: 他得罪了他的老板，于是几个月后他就被解雇了。

sentences.english: Your refusal to come might give offence.
sentences.chinese: 你如果拒绝来就会得罪人。

sentences.english: Jesus gave a stern warning about giving offense and causing others to lose their faith.
sentences.chinese: 得罪人和使人失去信心的情况被耶稣严厉地警告。

sentences.english: Wah dares to offend Our Majesty.
sentences.chinese: 华太师居然敢得罪我们皇爷。

sentences.english: He got across the boss, who made life very difficult for him.
sentences.chinese: 他得罪了上司，上司就给他小鞋穿。

sentences.english: But Huang Jiashan had offended the treacherous prime minister Yan Hao.
sentences.chinese: 黄嘉善却在京为官时，得罪了奸相严嵩。

sentences.english: The petty clerk was afraid of offending his boss.
sentences.chinese: 这个小职员不敢得罪他的老板。

sentences.english: What wrong did they do to the Catholic Church?
sentences.chinese: 他们哪里得罪了天主教堂？

sentences.english: I have not wronged you, but you are hunting me down to take my life.
sentences.chinese: 你虽然猎取我的命，我却没有得罪你。

sentences.english: May conduct a tour must say, but my mouth is very actually stupid, everywhere queers.
sentences.chinese: 可导游要会说，可我却嘴很笨，到处得罪人。

definition: to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
to offend
to provoke/to tease
to anger sb/to enrage
to provoke anger
to start a feud/to become enemies
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
to arouse dislike/to incur hatred
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)
to offend
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling
can't afford to offend/dare not provoke/difficult to deal with/insufferable
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
